docs.lead_paragraph: President Hu Jintao convened a meeting of the Standing Committee of the Politburo, and in a rare step immediately announced it to the public.

headline.main: China’s Leaders Take Visible Approach to Swine Flu
headline.print_headline: China’s Leaders Take Visible Approach to Swine Flu Scare

docs.lead_paragraph: As the number of confirmed cases in the U.S. rose to 114, Fort Worth became the nation’s first major city school district to close.

headline.seo: Fort Worth Closes Schools as Number of Swine Flu Cases Rises in U.S.
headline.main: Flu Prompts Shutdowns in Mexico, Texas
headline.sub: Obama Calls Swine Flu a Cause for Concern, but Not Panic;
headline.print_headline: Uncertainty And Doubts As Flu Cases Keep Rising

docs.snippet: As the number of confirmed cases in the U.S. rose to 114, Fort Worth became the nation’s first major city school district to close.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Gardiner Harris and Jeff Zeleny from Washington, Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City, and Ian Austen from Ottawa.

docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
docs.abstract: In this lesson, students engage in an inquiry into influenza A (H1N1), considering the virus and the pandemic from multiple perspectives and acting as advisers to share factual information they learn with their classmates and school communities. Click here for a companion lesson for Grades 3-5.
